text: Washington is doing nothing to lower the cost of health care for Arizonans. We need leaders who will protect those with pre-existing conditions and work to drive down costs.

Happy Birthday to one of the world's greatest treasures, the Grand Canyon National Park.

Mark and I think about Gabe Zimmerman all the time, but especially on days like today, what would‚Äôve been his 40th birthday. Gabe was my Outreach Director when he was killed by my side on January 8, 2011. Gabe made a profound impact everywhere he went‚Äîone that is remembered in so many meaningful ways: scholarships, a room in the US Capitol named for him, a trailhead just outside of Tucson, the Gabe Zimmerman Triple Crown race and Beyond-Tucson.  And today, his friends and family are at UC Santa Cruz to celebrate his life as they name a room in the student library for him. Elizabeth Cowell, the university‚Äôs librarian, put it thoughtfully: ‚ÄúWe hope to give Gabe‚Äôs inspired life a home on the campus that he loved so much.‚Äù Gabe always strived to make peoples‚Äô lives better. That‚Äôs just who he was. And we hope his memory inspires generations of students to go on to serve their communities. Just as Gabe would have wanted us all to do.
I‚Äôm not taking a dime of corporate PAC money. For too long, corporate influence has ruled Washington. We‚Äôve got to change that.

If you told me when I was 16 that I‚Äôd reach my dream of being a Navy pilot and astronaut, I wouldn‚Äôt have believed you. Now, my hope for Arizona is that everybody gets a chance to achieve their own American dream.

I‚Äôm running to be an independent voice for Arizona because we need leaders focused on solutions ‚Äî solutions like lowering the cost of health care, giving our children a quality education, and raising wages for working families.

This afternoon I toured West-MEC, a career and technical education school, to learn how they‚Äôre preparing students to enter our workforce. Many fields have openings for skilled workers, and I'm impressed with how effectively they‚Äôre training students to fill them.‚Ä¨

As a Navy vet, it hurts me to say this ‚Äî but if we‚Äôre going to win this November, we‚Äôre going to need an army. Mission For Arizona is the army we need. Join the mission at MissionForArizona.com.

What we‚Äôre seeing is the long term failure to properly fund Arizona schools. For the next generation to succeed, we must invest in our schools and teachers.

Rick, Willie, Mike, Kalpana, Dave, Laurel, and Ilan. I‚Äôll never forget that day 17 years ago when we lost seven friends and co-workers aboard the Space Shuttle Columbia. We honor their memory by answering the call to learn, discover, explore, and serve just like they did.

I‚Äôm proud to have the support of Human Rights Campaign and HRC Arizona in our mission to ensure all Arizonans can achieve their American dream free from discrimination. #FullSpeedAhead

Today's my mom's birthday, and I can't help but miss her. She was the one who really taught me what it means to be a public servant.

Arizona seniors have paid into Social Security and Medicare and depend on them to cover basic expenses and ensure healthy, dignified retirements. It‚Äôs critical that we protect and defend these programs.

I spent my entire career at NASA and in the Navy using science, data, and facts to solve difficult problems. Arizona needs independent leadership in the United States Senate. If you agree, then join this mission #ForArizona.

This is great news for Arizona. #USMCA will allow Arizona dairy farmers to compete in new markets, and I‚Äôm glad the agreement was strengthened with improved protections for workers.

Gabby Giffords and I had a great time riding in El Tour de Tucson. I can‚Äôt think of a better representation of Tucson than thousands of people coming together outdoors to help raise money for the causes they care about.

Nearly 2.8 million Arizonans have a pre-existing condition, myself included. We can't turn back the clock and allow people with pre-existing conditions to be denied coverage or face unaffordable costs.
Today is #LatinaEqualPayDay. The Latina wage gap is a justice issue, a family issue, and an issue for our economy here in Arizona. We've got to take it head on.

Thanks to all of the participants for their important work to make Arizona and our planet a more sustainable place to live. Climate change is a threat, but it's also an opportunity for Arizona to lead in the transition to a renewable economy and create good-paying jobs.

Happy #AmericanEducationWeek! I'm a proud product of public education. This week is a great chance to thank teachers for the difference they make in students' lives and ensuring every kid is prepared to succeed.

Sadly, Arizona has one of the highest rates of veteran suicide in the country. There is an urgent need to improve the quality and timeliness of care - particularly mental health care - that our veterans receive.
Today I joined former Navy SEAL Jimmy Hatch and Arizona veterans to discuss veterans health care and ensuring veterans with traumatic brain injuries get the care and community support they need.
Enjoyed touring the Ak-Chin community and meeting with tribal leadership today. Thank you to Chairman Miguel and council members for your time.

Wishing all those celebrating tonight a happy and blessed Rosh Hashanah. Shana tovah!

In awe of all of the young people demanding #ClimateAction now. There is no Planet B. The simple truth is that we have to do a better job taking care of THIS planet to protect it for this generation and the next.

Happy 72nd birthday to the U.S. Air Force. We have a healthy rivalry, but during my time in the Navy I was proud to serve alongside many of the brave men and women of our Air Force. We are grateful for your service.

Congratulations to these University of Arizona researchers! They were part of the team that captured the first-ever image of a black hole at the center of Messier 87 ‚Äî a galaxy 55 million light-years away. What a feat!

Proud to have the support of the UFCW Local 99 and its more than 23,000 members. Christina-Taylor was a young woman with bold ideas about what our government should look like. She deserved a lifetime to make those a reality, but never got that. 18 years ago we were attacked as a nation. Today we stand together to remember the thousands of innocent lives lost and those forever changed. We'll never forget the sacrifice of the first responders who risked everything to save lives that day. #NeverForget

A devastating loss for the city of Tucson and the Tucson Police Department. My thoughts are with Sgt. Timothy Froebe's family and loved ones.

Over 100,000 people have contributed to our grassroots campaign #ForArizona. With your help and support, we will continue fighting to make sure Washington puts hardworking Arizonans front and center.

Quite the honor to speak to the Arizona AFL-CIO to kick off #LaborDayWeekend. It was a great day to be with labor and recognize that unions created and continue to work to strengthen our middle class and won protections for all Americans. I‚Äôll always stand with working Arizonans.

Both my parents were union members. I'll always remember that and the important role unions play in standing up for and supporting workers and their families. #LaborDay

With back-to-school season in full swing, I wanted to recognize parents for their hard work. From dropping kids off at school to helping them with their math homework, I know it‚Äôs not always easy. But it‚Äôs so important. Thank you!

Happy 244th Birthday Tucson! After serving in the Navy and at NASA for 25 years, Tucson was the first place I ever chose to live. I‚Äôm so thankful for the people of Tucson who make this community so special!

Had a great time in Graham County and Greenlee County last week. Got a chance to hear from medical professionals, students, teachers, and small business owners about their community and the challenges they face.

One of the biggest problems in our politics today is the amount of corporate PAC money in politics. That's why I refuse to take a dime from corporate PACs to fund my campaign. I will always fight #ForArizona families, not special interests.

Grateful to San Carlos Apache Police Chief Benally for showing me around this afternoon. Glad I got the chance to stop at San Carlos Healthcare Corporation to meet some of the hardworking doctors and nurses.

Did you know Eastern Arizona College is the oldest community college in Arizona? Special thanks to the student leaders for taking the time to meet with me and share how we can best support community college students in Arizona.

She later transferred to Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication to pursue a degree in journalism.  Finding your passion is so important.  It not only helps kids grow into successful adults, it helps our communities and our economy to have young people find their way in the world.

Today on Navajo Code Talkers Day, we honor these heroes and the integral role they played in our victory in World War II.
My thoughts are with Chairman Lupe's family and the White Mountain Apache Tribe as we mourn this loss. After the Marine Corps, he was Chairman for 36 years - a true public servant.

The University of Arizona's first ever space camp just wrapped. I'm sure the participants had a blast exploring Biosphere 2! Biosphere 2 is helping train the next generation of space explorers and astronauts.

Today marks 84 years since the Social Security Act was signed into law. #SocialSecurity has enabled generations to have a secure retirement. It‚Äôs important to the economic security of Arizonans. We must protect it. #SocSec84

With this new Boys & Girls Clubs of America  youth facility, the Pascua Yaqui Tribe will be able to serve more than 900 kids and provide a great space for them to learn and participate in team sports.
Had a great time exploring downtown Clifton with Mayor Luis Montoya. Thanks to all the small business owners who took the time to chat about their businesses and their community.
Staying healthy on the campaign trail isn't always easy. But it helps that working out is something my daughter Claire and I have always enjoyed doing together. She pushes me pretty hard!

Too many Arizona seniors struggle to pay for their prescription drugs. Nearly a quarter of seniors can't afford their medication. We have to take on the drug companies to bring down the cost of Rx drugs.
A big welcome home to these Arizona National Guard servicemen and servicewomen after a year-long deployment. Thank you for serving. We are grateful to have you home!

As students go back to school, I can't help but think about my girls' first days of school past, here they are on their first day of the 6th and 8th grade. #ThrowbackThursday

The cost of higher education should not leave students with a burden of debt. We need to find ways to make it more affordable for students to take the next step in their education, whether it's at an apprenticeship program, community college or university.

Early childhood education has long-term benefits for our families, communities and economy. The return of Coconino Community College's Early Childhood Education training program and programs like it in rural counties across the state will bring important teaching resources to teachers in their communities.

First established by General George Washington, the Purple Heart, initially called the Badge of Military Merit, is the oldest military award. Today on Purpl eHeart Day, we honor and thank the men and women that paid the ultimate sacrifice and those wounded in the line of duty. Thank you for your service to our nation.

#OnThisDay in 1965, President Johnson signed the Voting Rights Act into law. This was the result of tireless work by Americans fighting for justice and equal access to the ballot box. Today, we've still got work to do to expand voting rights.
29 dead from two mass shootings in less than 24 hours. This hate and violence has no place in America. We cannot wait any longer. The Senate needs to act now to save lives.

Like both me and Gabby, over 2 million Arizonans have a pre-existing condition. Raising the cost of health care is not an option. I will always stand up for those with pre-existing conditions now and in the Senate.

On day one of my campaign, I made a pledge not to take corporate PAC money. We can't let special interests corrupt our politics and influence politicians who are supposed to represent people not corporate PACs.
